alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 01 at 2:04PM MST until December 04 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SATURDAY TO 5 AM MST MONDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations below 6000 feet of 2 to 6 inches, except 6 to 24 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Totals exceeding 12 inches are most likely above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph will create widespread blowing and drifting snow at all elevations. * WHERE...South Hills, Raft River Region, East and Southeastern Highlands, the Sawtooths and Stanley Basin. * WHEN...From 5 AM Saturday to 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
